definition: affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: It said farming didn't pay in their country.
sentences.chinese: 它說在他們國家務農不上算。

sentences.english: In the dry season, they farm.
Unfortunately, because the landlord component was forced back to farming.
sentences.chinese: 可惜，因爲地主成分被迫回鄉務農。

sentences.english: But he worries that farming has been turned into “legalised gambling”.
sentences.chinese: 但是他擔心務農已經轉變爲“合法的賭博”了。

sentences.english: We were farmers in Jonesboro, Ark., on 114 acres of land.
sentences.chinese: 我們家在瓊斯伯樂務農，擁有114英畝的土地。

sentences.english: Nearly 700million people depend on agriculture for their livelihood in India.
sentences.chinese: 印度有將近七億人以務農爲生。

sentences.english: Mount Athos monks were once recruited from farming backgrounds.
sentences.chinese: 阿索斯山的修道士們一度是從務農的人中招募的。

sentences.english: He plans to move far away and return to farming.
sentences.chinese: 他準備遠走他鄉，繼續務農。

sentences.english: People may not be hungry, but this is farming at its most basic.
sentences.chinese: 人們並不會忍飢挨餓，但務農是這裏的生活之道。

sentences.english: I was born in a farmer family, her father is farming mother.
sentences.chinese: 我出生於一個農民家庭，爸爸是篾匠媽媽務農。

sentences.english: For people who relied on agriculture for their living this was a serious matter.
sentences.chinese: 對於以務農爲生的來說，這是一個很嚴重的問題。

sentences.english: They made a living in Shanghai during the slack seasons of farming and returned during the busy ones.
sentences.chinese: 他們多在農閒期奔赴上海謀生，又在農忙時返鄉務農。

sentences.english: Farm-friendly policies are encouraging many to stay in rural areas on the land.
sentences.chinese: 政府出臺的惠農政策也鼓勵農民工留在農村務農。

definition: to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
